What is OPTION_ID_REFERRALREQUIRED in Verus, and what does it do?
OPTION_ID_REFERRALREQUIRED is a flag in Verus that, when set to 16, requires referrals for a specific chain.

s referrals OPTION_ID_REFERRALREQUIRED = 16    // if set, this chain requires referrals OPTION_TOKEN = 32           // if set, this is a token, not a native currency OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID ```
./raw_txt_input/release_notes.md
What does OPTION_TOKEN do in Verus, and how does it affect a currency?
OPTION_TOKEN is a flag in Verus that, when set to 32, indicates that a currency is a token, rather than a native currency.

s referrals OPTION_ID_REFERRALREQUIRED = 16    // if set, this chain requires referrals OPTION_TOKEN = 32           // if set, this is a token, not a native currency OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID ```

What is the purpose of OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY in Verus, and how does it affect a chain?
OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY is a flag in Verus that, when set to 64, allows PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to a single currency.

s referrals OPTION_ID_REFERRALREQUIRED = 16    // if set, this chain requires referrals OPTION_TOKEN = 32           // if set, this is a token, not a native currency OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID ```

What does OPTION_GATEWAY do in Verus, and how does it affect currency routing?
OPTION_GATEWAY is a flag in Verus that, when set to 128, indicates that a chain routes external currencies.

s referrals OPTION_ID_REFERRALREQUIRED = 16    // if set, this chain requires referrals OPTION_TOKEN = 32           // if set, this is a token, not a native currency OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID ```

What is OPTION_PBAAS in Verus, and what does it define?
OPTION_PBAAS is a flag in Verus that, when set to 256, defines a PBaaS chain.

s referrals OPTION_ID_REFERRALREQUIRED = 16    // if set, this chain requires referrals OPTION_TOKEN = 32           // if set, this is a token, not a native currency OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID ```

What is OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER in Verus, and what does it do?
OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER is a flag in Verus that, when set to 512, indicates that a specific PBaaS gateway is the default converter and will publish prices.

s referrals OPTION_ID_REFERRALREQUIRED = 16    // if set, this chain requires referrals OPTION_TOKEN = 32           // if set, this is a token, not a native currency OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID ```

What is OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER in Verus, and what does it control?
OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER is a flag in Verus that, when set to 1024, controls top-level ID and currency registration on a launch chain when not set on a gateway.

s referrals OPTION_ID_REFERRALREQUIRED = 16    // if set, this chain requires referrals OPTION_TOKEN = 32           // if set, this is a token, not a native currency OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID ```

What is OPTION_NFT_TOKEN in Verus, and what does it represent?
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN is a flag in Verus that, when set to 2048, represents a single satoshi NFT token, which tokenizes control over the root ID.

s referrals OPTION_ID_REFERRALREQUIRED = 16    // if set, this chain requires referrals OPTION_TOKEN = 32           // if set, this is a token, not a native currency OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID ```
